Docs.summary: Provides data for a cancelable event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A cancelable event is raised when a component is about to perform an action that can be canceled, such as logging on to a Web site.
The LoginCancelEventArgs class provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to indicate whether the event should be canceled. A LoginCancelEventArgs object is used with controls that have cancelable actions, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> control, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PasswordRecovery> control.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LoggingIn> event to ensure that the user has entered a well-formed e-mail address in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.UserName%2A> property. If not, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LoggingIn> event handler cancels the logon attempt by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the LoginCancelEventArgs object to `true`.Then the error message specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.InstructionText%2A> property is displayed.

## Remarks You can use the Cancel property to indicate whether an event, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LoggingIn> event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoggingOut> event, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ChangePassword.ChangingPassword> event, should be canceled.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LoggingIn> event to ensure that the user has entered a well-formed e-mail address in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.UserName%2A> property. If not, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Login.LoggingIn> event handler sets the Cancel property to `true`, and an error message is displayed. For an .aspx file that can be used to run the example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs> topic.
